tuv.seg: President of Ireland and legislation
An tUachtarán agus reachtaíocht
Legislation starts life as a Bill which is passed by both Houses of the Oireachtas (the Irish parliament)
Tosaíonn reachtaíocht mar Bhille, a ritheann dá Theach an Oireachtais
Every Bill must be signed by the Irish President before it can become law
Ní mór don Uachtarán gach Bille a shíniú roimh dó theacht ina dlí
As soon as the Bill has been passed by both Houses of the Oireachtas, it is presented to the President for signature
Chomh luath agus a ritheann dá Theach an Oireachtais Bille cuirfear é ós comhair an Uachtaráin le síniú
A Bill must be signed on the 5th, 6th or 7th day after it has been presented to the President
Ní mór bille a shíniú ar an 5ú, 6ú nó 7ú lá tar éis é a chur chuig an Uachtarán
However, if the Seanad agrees, the Government may request that the Bill be signed sooner
Ach, má aontaíonn an Seanad is féidir leis an Rialtas iarratas a dhéanamh an Bille a shíniú níos luaithe
When a Bill has been presented to the President, they have the power to refer it to the Supreme Court within 7 days
Nuair a chuirtear Bille ós comhair an Uachtaráin le síniú, tá sé de chumhacht aige nó aici an bille a chur faoi bhreith na Cúirte Uachtaraí taobh istigh de 7 lá
This power is exercised by the President when there is doubt as to whether the Bill is constitutional
Déanann an tUachtarán é seo sa chás go bhfuil amhras ann nach bhfuil an Bille ag teacht leis an mBunreacht
They must first consult with the Council of State but the decision to refer the Bill is the President's alone
Ní mór dó/dí dul i gcomhairle ar dtús leis an gComhairle Stáit ach is é an tUachtarán amháin a dhéanann cinneadh an Bille a chur faoi bhreith na Cúirte
If a Bill is referred to the Supreme Court, it must decide whether or not the Bill conflicts with the Constitution
Má chuirtear Bille faoi bhreith na Cúirte Uachtaraí ní mór don Chúirt cinneadh a dhéanamh an bhfuil an bille in aghaidh an Bhunreachta
If the Supreme Court holds that the Bill is unconstitutional, the President cannot sign it
Más é breith na Cúirte Uachtaraí go bhfuil an Bille in aghaidh an Bhunreachta ní féidir leis an Uachtarán é a shíniú
Once a Bill has been signed, the President must then publish a notice in Iris Oifiguil (the official State gazette) stating that the Bill has become law
Nuair atá Bille sínithe, ní mór ansin don Uachtarán fógra a chur san Iris Oifigiúil ag fógairt go bhfuil an Bille ina dhlí
If the Government wishes to change or amend the Constitution, a Bill must be passed by both Houses of the Oireachtas to amend the Constitution
Más mian leis an Rialtas athrú nó leasú a dhéanamh ar an mBunreacht, ní mór do dhá Theach an Oireachtais Bille a rith chun an Bunreacht a leasú
The Irish people must then approve the Bill in a constitutional referendum
Ní mór ansin do Phobal na hÉireann tacú leis an mBille i reifreann bunreachtúil
Once the Bill has been approved by the people in a referendum, the President must then sign the Bill so that the Constitution can be amended
Nuair atá toil an phobail tugtha don bhille i reifreann ní mór don Uachtarán an Bille a shíniú leis an mBunreacht a leasú
The President has 2 additional powers in relation to legislation that have never been exercised
Tá 2 chumhacht eile ag an Uachtarán maidir le reachtaíocht nár cuireadh i bhfeidhm ariamh
They may refuse to sign a Bill if a majority of the members of the Seanad and at least one-third of the members of the Dáil petition them not to sign the Bill

Is féidir leis/léi diúltú bille a shíniú má chuireann tromlach de chomhaltaí Sheanad Éireann agus, ar a laghad, aon trian de chomhaltaí Dháil Éireann comhachainí chuige/chuici ag iarraidh air /uirthi diúltú an Bille a shíniú
The President must consult with the Council of State before deciding within 6 days whether or not to sign the Bill
Ní mór don Uachtarán dul i gcomhairle leis an gComhairle Stáit taobh istigh de shé lá roimh cinneadh a dhéanamh an Bille a shíniú nó gan é sin a dhéanamh
The President also has a power in relation to possible Money Bills
Tá cumhacht ag an Uachtarán maidir le Billí Airgid
The Seanad has less power in relation to Money Bills
Tá níos lú cumhachta ag an Seanad maidir le Billí Airgid
If a conflict arises between the Dáil and the Seanad as to whether or not a particular Bill is a Money Bill, the Seanad may ask the President to refer the question to a Committee of Privileges
Má bhíonn easaontas idir Dáil agus Seanad Éireann an Bille Airgid atá i gceist le Bille faoi leith, is féidir leis an Seanad iarraidh ar an Uachtarán an cheist a chur faoi bhráid Choiste Pribhléidí
The President must consult with the Council of State before they decide whether or not to refer it
Ní mór don Uachtarán dul i gcomhairle leis an gComhairle Stáit roimh cinneadh a dhéanamh an cheist a chur faoi bhráid an Choiste
